definition: to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)
ministry/department/section/part/division/troops/board/classifier for works of literature, films, machines etc

sentences.english: The order of commendation from the general headquarters lifted up still higher the morale of the troops.
sentences.chinese: 总司令部的嘉奖令大大地鼓舞了那个部队的士气。

sentences.english: Only the Kalobaw strategic command refuses to accept BGF.
sentences.chinese: 只有卡洛堡前线司令部拒绝接受改编。

sentences.english: Command, huang feng call third reconnaissance teams, have been slow to respond.
sentences.chinese: 司令部内，黄鸣锋呼叫第三侦察小队，迟迟没有回应。

sentences.english: Eikenberry was in fact the commander of the Combined Forces Command Afghanistan (CFC-A).
sentences.chinese: 艾肯伯里实际上是驻阿富汗联军司令部司令官。

sentences.english: The captain applied to headquarters for a transfer.
sentences.chinese: 上尉向司令部请求调动。

sentences.english: Huang feng man reaches the command, talk between an Jiang Yuan came in.
sentences.chinese: 黄鸣锋等人到达司令部，说话间姜原进来寒暄。

sentences.english: Africom also war-gamed a full-scale conflict in the Gulf of Guinea.
sentences.chinese: 非洲司令部也参与了几内亚湾的全面冲突。

sentences.english: At the Mariveles Navy headquarters he said good-bye to his work gang.
sentences.chinese: 他在马里韦莱斯海军司令部向他的那帮工人告别。

sentences.english: But many of his troops, especially his protégés in the command structure, disagree.
sentences.chinese: 不过他的许多官兵尤其是司令部的参谋不这么看。

sentences.english: The quarrelsome general quarreled about a quarter quart of oil in the headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 好争吵的将军在司令部为四分夸脱油而争吵。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the Air Staff's fears about inaccurate shooting had been borne-out.
sentences.chinese: 其间，空军司令部担心有关不准确的射击被证实。

sentences.english: The headquarters ordered that all the armies carry out a general attack together.
sentences.chinese: 司令部发出命令，各路大军一起开始总攻。

sentences.english: Panetta gave U.S. European Command the go-ahead to assist the Turkish government.
sentences.chinese: 帕内塔批准美国欧洲司令部对土耳其政府进行援助。

sentences.english: U. S. Cyber Command unified management of network security and network operations command.
sentences.chinese: 网络司令部统管美军网络安全和网络作战指挥。

sentences.english: Africom innocuously brands itself as "advising and training" military forces.
sentences.chinese: 非洲司令部无害地标榜自己为“资讯和培训”的军队。

sentences.english: The RC—Southwest region lends itself to armored operations.
sentences.chinese: 兰潘说，西南地区司令部想开展装甲作战。

definition: war zone/combat zone/(military) theater of operations
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
geographical area of command/(PLA) military district
Military Commission of the Communist Party Central Committee/same as 軍委|军委
